title.narrative: 3.3 QUALITY BASIC EDUCATION

description.narrative: 3.3 The education system has strengthened capacity to improve the quality of basic education., which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2023, more children have improved and meaningful learning outcomes

participating-org.narrative: ERNEST BAI KOROMA UNIVERSITY OF SCI AND TECHNOLOGY MAKENI UNIVERSITY CO
MINISTRY OF BASIC AND SENIOR SECOND EDUCATION

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 3.3 The education system has strengthened capacity to improve the quality of basic education.

description.narrative: In collaboration with the MBSSE and Teaching Service Commission (TSC), UNICEF supported the training of 6,925 teachers (4,781 males; 2,144 females). This represents 78 percent of early grade teachers in six target districts and contributes to improved quality of basic education by strengthening the capacity of the education system to ensure more qualified, skilled and motivated teachers are equitably deployed. UNICEF also supported important evidence for early grade learning outcomes through the National Early Grade Reading Assessment/Early Grade Mathematics Assessment (EGRA/EGMA). Based on the results, strategies to improve foundational learning outcomes are under development to strengthen teacher training. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2022
